modules.description: This module defines data types for representing structured documentation comments, including text formatting styles, reference kinds, and documentation tags. It supports parsing and handling of inline markup, cross-references, and standard or custom documentation annotations. Concrete use cases include processing OCaml documentation comments for rendering or analysis, and building tools that interpret structured comments in source code.

This module defines detailed error types and location information for parsing and lexing OCaml documentation comments. It includes specific error cases for both lexer and parser stages, such as unclosed delimiters and unexpected input, along with positional tracking using line and column numbers. It is used to report precise syntax and structure issues during documentation comment processing.

This module parses and processes structured documentation comments in OCaml source code, handling inline markup, cross-references, and custom annotations. It operates on lexbuf input to produce structured data representing documentation tags and formatting, with dedicated types for parsed content and detailed error reporting. Concrete use cases include extracting and analyzing OCaml documentation for rendering tools or static analysis systems.
